content: I swapped Test 3 and Validator 3 because the test cases didn't test the rounding ;)

The puzzle is great. The description is OK, but can be improved upon in my opinion. I also suggest leaving out the reference to pythagorean distances and the way of calculating the lengths as both are parts of resolving the puzzle. I will upvote if this is updated.

Below my suggestion for description:

Goal
You must output the length of a race track, given a number of coordinates. If the track has 2 coordinates, they represent  a start and finish line. If the track has 3 coordinates or more, the first coordinate represents the start/finish, while the others represent checkpoints that are required to be passed through in order.

Notes
Once the track length is calculated, it should be returned as a whole number.
The distances between coordinates are always a straight line.

I see this as potentially having rounding issues.
      Round type is not specified.
      Rounding between steps vs. rounding at the end can give different answers.
